org.json.stream

Class BuilderLimits

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.json.stream.BuilderLimits
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BuilderLimits
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Builder limits, based on similar limits used in some XML parsers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BuilderLimits()
      Create a new BuilderLimits class with large, but bounded, limits on object building.

      • getFilter

        public LimitFilter getFilter()
        Soft filtering for any object, array, or value that passes the other limits provided. If the filter rejects the value, it will be skipped, along with any nested content, and parsing continues.
        Returns:
        the filter for accepting or rejecting values

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(LimitFilter filter)
        Soft filtering for any object, array, or value that passes the other limits provided. If the filter rejects the value, it will be skipped and parsing continues.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter for creating objects, arrays, or values

      • secureDefaults

        public static BuilderLimits secureDefaults()
        Return a BuilderLimits object that contains some limits for secure processing. These can be customised as needed.

        The limits specify:

        • Number limits sufficient for parsing Long and Double values. These conform to the I-JSON requirements (RFC 7493)
        • Key length limits sufficient for most typical requirements, similar to XML attribute name limits
        • String length sufficient to fit in a Java String object
        • Content node limits sufficient for most typical requirements, similar to XML content node limits
        • Nesting level limits sufficient to avoid stack limits when using recursive algorithms
        Returns:
        a BuilderLimits object with secure processing limits
